    A house number is considered simple if it contains only digits or if it contains only digits and an ending letter.

    Works like getStreetNumberAndSearchString but only splits simple strings so that we can be sure that the result looks good if we glue the stuff together again (regardless of whether the number should be first or last), also this function doesn't remove odd characters or converts accented to non-accented characters.

    Returns true if the word is an exact match to one or more than one of the words in itemName.
  • bool wordsCorrectOrder (const vector< const char * > words, const char *itemName, bool *firstWordBegins=NULL)
    Returns true if the words in query match the words in itemName in correct order.

Detailed Description

Some useful string functions mainly used by searchmodule.

MC2String StringSearchUtility::copyUpper2 (  mc2TextIterator  it  )  [inline, static]
 

Makes a uppercase copy of str and returns it.

Supports ISO8859-1. Also converts german sharp S into two ordinary S:s. Will probably allocate too much memory for the string every time, hence the number2.

Parameters:
str is the string to copy and to upercase.
Returns:
the new uppercase string.

int StringSearchUtility::getLevDist (  const char *  a,
const char *  b,
uint16  maxDist
)  [static]
 

Calculates the distance between two strings, if the distance is within a certain limit.

Examples: $(a,b)$ = (Baravägen, Braavägen) => distance = 2

$(a,b)$ = (Baravägen, Bravgen) => distance = 2

$(a,b)$ = (Baravägen, Baravägenn) => distance = 1

Parameters:
a,b Words to calculate the distance between
maxDist Maximum allowed distance
return The distance if it is less than or equal to maxDist, -1 otherwise

Referenced by Trie::getLevDist().

uint32 StringSearchUtility::getUKPostalCodeNbrGroups (  const MC2String &  code  )  [static]
 

Parameters:
code The postal code to calculate number of groups of.
Returns:
Number of levels in the postal code supplied in code. E.g. "N35A 6QW" -> 4, "N3 5" -> 3, "N" -> 1

MC2String StringSearchUtility::removeUKPostalCodeGroup (  const MC2String &  code  )  [static]
 

Returns the uk postal code with one group removed.

N35A 6QW -> N35A 6 -> N35A -> N N3 5AQ -> N3 5 -> N3 -> N

void StringSearchUtility::simpleGetStreetNumberAndName (  const MC2String &  searchString,
int &  streetNumber,
MC2String &  streetName
)  [static]
 

Works like getStreetNumberAndSearchString but only splits simple strings so that we can be sure that the result looks good if we glue the stuff together again (regardless of whether the number should be first or last), also this function doesn't remove odd characters or converts accented to non-accented characters.

Parameters:
searchString The string to split.
streetNumber A reference to the street number.
streetName A reference to the street name.

void StringSearchUtility::splitIntoWords (  vector< MC2String > &  words,
mc2TextIterator  str
)  [static]
 

Splits the incoming string into words using isWordSeparator.

Parameters:
words A vector of pointers into the str.
str The string to split. Can be const char* or MC2String.

Referenced by anyWordMatch(), and wholeWordMatchOneWord().

MC2String StringSearchUtility::stripSearchString (  const MC2String &  searchString  )  [inline, static]
 

Removes street number and anything else that might follow the first digit.

If the first character is a digit, the leading digits are skipped and the rest of the string is returned.

Parameters:
searchString the searchstring e.g. 'tunav39b656'
Returns:
the streetname (or whatever it is) without numbers e.g. 'tunav'.
